description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fcrua","text":"This protocol decribes how to make 1 L of Pseudomonas isolation agar for the culturing of Pseudomonas bacterial species on plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":42,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":90,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emath","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u9ad","text":"The use of a genus specific isolation media such as Pseudomonas isolation media reduces the risk of plate contamination with a diiferent bacterial species when trying to isolate a particular bacterial strain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"68spj","text":"Read SDS for Pseudomonas Isolation Agar before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":13,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"empbf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ge03","text":"Bottle can be extremely hot immediately following autoclave. Use thermal gloves for handling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1rhss","text":"Once Pseudomonas isolation media has been autoclaved, all work should be carried out in a laminar flow hood to prevent contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":12,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct3c6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hm8m","text":"1 L of Pseudomonas isolation agar makes ~20 plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":7,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ov8q","text":"At 4 °C unused plates can be stored for around 2 weeks prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adi3g","text":"Once used, plates containing bacterial colonies can be stored in air-tight container/bag at 4 °C for a maximum of 2 weeks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33auc","text":"Prior to disposal, plates containing bacterial colonies must be wrapped in Parafilm and autoclaved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"1gl71","text":"Add 45.03 g Pseudomonas isolation agar and 20 mL of 100% glycerol per 980 mL of water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":12,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C884CE30E1BF11E88BC7E11DED29DF72","id":679858,"previous_guid":null,"section":null}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9g2f8","text":"Mix well by inverting bottle several times until powder dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nl9q","text":"Sterilize by autoclaving for 20 min at 15 psi (1.05 kg\/cm2) on liquid cycle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1o21","text":"Following autoclave (while media still liquid) pour Pseudomonas isolation agar from bottle into plates within a laminar flow hood. Allow ~50 mL per plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C89F8220E1BF11E88BC7E11DED29DF72","id":679861,"previous_guid":"C89F5B10E1BF11E88BC7E11DED29DF72","section":null}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mrs6","text":"Leave plates in laminar hood until agar sets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9s5bg","text":"When agar has set, invert plates and store in an air tight bag at 4 \u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm0nl","text":"Plates should be removed from 4 \u00b0C at least 1 h before use and placed at room temperature. To prevent condensation from lid dropping onto agar surface, wipe lids dry with Kimwipe before placing at room temperature and store plates inverted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C8A04570E1BF11E88BC7E11DED29DF72","id":679864,"previous_guid":"C8A01E60E1BF11E88BC7E11DED29DF72","section":null}
